_prev_prog_3.Description:
The RMP Prevention Program is comprised of the 14 elements of OSHA's PSM program: Employee Participation, Process Safety Information, Process Hazard Analysis, Management of Change, Pre-Startup Safety Review, Operating Procedures, Hot Work Permits, Employee Training, Incident Investigation, Mechanical Integrity, Emergency Planning & Response, Contractor Safety, Audits and Trade Secrets 



Employee participation brings together people that know and understood the system to develop the Program. Process safety information is a collection of data that allows us to identify and understand the hazards posed by the refrigeration system. This analysis identifies potential process failures that could result in an uncontrolled release of ammonia. 



In order to safely manage changes that need to be made to the processes containing ammonia, a system of checks and balances has been established. This system evaluates safety prior to the work being done, and provides a review of the system to assure that once started, it will run as designed. Standard operating procedures are in place for each operating phase and are followed by the workers who operate or maintain the system. The integrity of the refrigeration system equipment is maintained according to recognized and generally accepted good engineering practices and according to a documented preventive maintenance program.



A training program is in place for those employees and contractors involved in working on or around the refrigeration system and covers operating procedures, health and safety hazards, emergency operations, and safe work practices. The facility also has a training program for all employees and contractors regarding the hazards of ammonia and safe work practices to be used. 



Any incidents related to the ammonia refrigeration systems are promptly investigated. All incidents are analyzed, resolved, and findings shared with affected employees. In order to assure compliance with all elements of the prevention program, an audit is conducted every three years including a report of the findings and documentation of any deficiencies corrected.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
DESCRIPTION OF FACILITY AND REGULATED SUBSTANCES



The Calbee facility produces potato products. The plant site consists of a main processing plant, refrigeration facility, and refrigerated cold storage. The refrigeration facilities use anhydrous ammonia as the refrigerant.



ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM



The RMP Prevention Program is comprised of the 14 elements of OSHA's PSM program: Employee Participation, Process Safety Information, Process Hazard Analysis, Management of Change, Pre-Startup Safety Review, Operating Procedures, Hot Work Permits, Employee Training, Incident Investigation, Mechanical Integrity, Emergency Planning & Response, Contractor Safety, Audits and Trade Secrets 



Employee participation brings together people that know and understood the system to develop the Program. Process safety information is a collection of data that allows us to identify and understand the hazards posed by the refrigeration system. This analysis identifies potential process failures that could result in an uncontrolled release of ammonia. 



In order to safely manage changes that need to be made to the processes containing ammonia, a system of checks and balances has been established. This system evaluates safety prior to the work being done, and provides a review of the system to assure that once started, it will run as designed. Standard operating procedures are in place for each operating phase and are followed by the workers who operate or maintain the system. The integrity of the refrigeration system equipment is maintained according to recognized and generally accepted good engineering practices and according to a documented preventive maintenance program.



A training program is in place for those employees and contractors involved in working on or around the refrigeration system and covers operating procedures, health and safety hazards, emergency operations, and safe work practices. The facility also has a training program for all employees an

d contractors regarding the hazards of ammonia and safe work practices to be used. 



Any incidents related to the ammonia refrigeration systems are promptly investigated. All incidents are analyzed, resolved, and findings shared with affected employees. In order to assure compliance with all elements of the prevention program, an audit is conducted every three years including a report of the findings and documentation of any deficiencies corrected.



FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY



There have been no accidental releases at the Calbee facility in the last five years from refrigeration system that resulted in deaths, injuries, or significant property damage on site or offsite.



EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM 



The facility has an emergency action plan which has been coordinated (reviewed) with local emergency responders including the Boardman Police and Fire Departments (including ambulance service), the Oregon State Regional HazMat Response Team (in Hermiston), Good Shepherd Community Hospital (in Hermiston), and Morrow County LEPC and Emergency Management.



Training of employees and contractors includes providing a copy of the plan upon initial employment at Calbee and reviewing it for their specific assignment, annual refresher training for current employees, and review for all whenever the plan is changed. In addition, plant evacuation drills are conducted on a regular basis.
